remarks: A lattice element is zero iff its isomorphism is the zero subspace. (Contributed by NM, 16-Aug-2014.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
dih0b.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
dih0b.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
dih0b.o $e |- .0. = ( 0. ` K ) $.
dih0b.i $e |- I = ( ( DIsoH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dih0b.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dih0b.z $e |- Z = ( 0g ` U ) $.
dih0b.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
dih0b.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. B ) $.
dih0bN $p |- ( ph -> ( X = .0. <-> ( I ` X ) = { Z } ) ) $.
